content.raw:
My bad.  I was using score.log directly instead of doing the 

```
#!python

gz log -e -f state.log --filter *.pose/*.pose > qual_1.log
```

step.
Now it runs and reports scores and colors.  Unfortunately, the results I get are not the same as the real values.  I'm surprised by that, since when I use markers in rviz to show the locations, they are directly on the lights, no error visible to the eye.  Is there any chance that we are using slightly different reference frames?
For my answer entry of 

```
#!python

answer 2.83569 -0.362355 -0.26923 0 0 1 51 228000000
```

the test output is:


```
#!python

          Position: real             [2.7580 -0.4194 1.0045]
                    answer           [2.7489 -0.3621 1.2747]
                    euclidean error  [0.276306]
```
so there is some sort of transform from my logged answer to the answer shown in the test score.
content.html:
My bad. I was using score.log directly instead of doing the 

gz log -e -f state.log --filter *.pose/*.pose > qual_1.log

step. Now it runs and reports scores and colors. Unfortunately, the results I get are not the same as the real values. I'm surprised by that, since when I use markers in rviz to show the locations, they are directly on the lights, no error visible to the eye. Is there any chance that we are using slightly different reference frames? For my answer entry of 

answer 2.83569 -0.362355 -0.26923 0 0 1 51 228000000

the test output is:

          Position: real             [2.7580 -0.4194 1.0045]
                    answer           [2.7489 -0.3621 1.2747]
                    euclidean error  [0.276306]

so there is some sort of transform from my logged answer to the answer shown in the test score.
